hint: Apply conservative optimizations by pushing filters earlier, converting implicit joins to explicit joins, and pre-filtering dimension tables to reduce join sizes while maintaining the original query structure.
Isolate selective dimension filters (date, item) into materialized CTEs, then restructure the main UNION query with explicit joins to improve join ordering and reduce intermediate result sizes.

Use aggressive prefetching by creating multiple materialized CTEs for filtered dimension and fact data, then restructure the self-join pattern to compute aggregates once instead of scanning large fact tables multiple times.

Apply novel structural transformations such as decomposing the self-join into a single aggregation CTE with year grouping, then deriving prev/curr years via conditional aggregation or window functions to eliminate redundant scans and optimize ratio calculations.
